subject: Personal Finance
title: What Saving Really Buys
description: A micro-lesson that makes What Saving Really Buys usable.

hook.text: Saving doesn't buy things. It buys options. The option to quit, to rest, to wait, to choose.

buildup.text: Financial writer Morgan Housel calls savings 'the gap between your ego and your income.'

discovery.text: Savings buy flexibility. The ability to say no to a bad job or yes to an opportunity.

twist.text: Many wealthy people stay in jobs they hate because their lifestyle requires every dollar they earn.

climax.text: True wealth isn't what you accumulate. It's what you can afford to walk away from.

quiz.question: According to Morgan Housel, what are savings?
options: The gap between your ego and your income
